paper_abstract: Reduced ordered binary decision diagram (ROBDD) is one of the most influential knowledge compilation languages. We generalize it by associating some implied literals with each node to propose a new language called ROBDD with implied literals (ROBDD-) and show that ROBDD- can meet most of the querying requirements involved in the knowledge compilation map. Then, we discuss a kind of subsets of ROBDD- called ROBDD- with precisely implied literals , where ROBDD- is isomorphic to ROBDD. ROBDD- has uniqueness over any given linear order of variables. We mainly focus on ROBDD- and demonstrate that: (a) it is a canonical representation on any given variable order; (b) it is the most succinct subset in ROBDD- and thus also meets most of the querying requirements; (c) given any logical operation ROBDD supports in polytime, ROBDD- can also support it in time polynomial in the sizes of the equivalent ROBDDs. Moreover, we propose an ROBDD- compilation algorithm for any and an ROBDD- compilation algorithm, and then we implement an ROBDD- package called BDDjLu. Our preliminary experimental results indicate that: (a) the compilation results of ROBDD- are significantly smaller than those of ROBDD; (b) the standard d-DNNF compiler c2d and our ROBDD- compiler do not dominate the other, yet ROBDD- has canonicity and supports more querying requirements and relatively efficient logical operations; and (c) the method that first compiles knowledge base into ROBDD- and then converts ROBDD- into ROBDD provides an efficient ROBDD compiler.
paper_title: Reduced ordered binary decision diagram with implied literals: a new knowledge compilation approach
